content.question: A student places a piece of <math alttext="I 2 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in <math alttext="50.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>50.0</mn> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> mL</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> of <math alttext="H 2 O liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, another piece of <math alttext="I 2 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the same mass in <math alttext="50.0 milliliters" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>50.0</mn> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mtext> mL</mtext> <mtext> </mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> of <math alttext="C 6 H 14 liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and shakes the mixtures. The results are shown above. What do the results indicate about the intermolecular interactions of the substances?

choices.label: <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have similar intermolecular interactions, and <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C 6 H 14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> do not.

<math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C 6 H 14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> have similar intermolecular interactions, and <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> do not.

<math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="C 6 H 14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> all have similar intermolecular interactions.

<math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="C 6 H 14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> have three completely different types of intermolecular interactions.

content.answer: <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C 6 H 14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> have similar intermolecular interactions, and <math alttext="I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> do not.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
